column2: PENNSYLVANIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Pennsylvania
column6: PA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: means that you need to stop.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column10: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 2. This sign warns that:
column4: the pavement ends.
column6: traffic must merge right.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 3. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for yeild signs.
column6: exclusively for stop signs.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column10: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 4. If your blood alcohol level is .04, you:
column4: are 2 – 7 times more likely to have a crash than a person who has not consumed any.
column6: are above the legal blood alcohol limit but fine to drive.
column8: can be very sure that you will drive safely.
column10: should drink plenty of coffee before getting behind the wheel of your car.

column2: 5. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column10: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 6. If a green arrow turns into a green light, you:
column4: may still turn but you must yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: still have the right of way to turn.
column8: no longer have to turn the way the arrow indicates.
column10: may no longer turn and must proceed straight.

column2: 7. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more quickly
column6: drive much faster

column2: 8. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.
column6: when it stops raining.

column2: 9. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 10. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column6: Use your ABS System.

column2: 11. If you see this sign above your lane, you:
column4: may continue through the interchange or exit the freeway in this lane.
column6: may stay in this lane and continue through the interchange.
column8: may not exit the freeway in this lane.
column10: must exit the freeway if you stay in this lane.

column2: 12. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 13. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: Warning signs

column2: 14. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 15. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 16. Before turning, you should:
column4: change lanes.
column6: increase your speed.
column10: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 17. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column8: the speed limit on that route.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 18. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how fit you are.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.
